etymologies: Old English innung ‘a putting or getting in’, related to in. The current sense dates from the mid 19th century

definitions: a division of a game during which the two teams alternate as offense and defense and during which each team is allowed three outs while batting.
shortDefinitions: each division of game during which both sides have turn at batting

definitions: a single turn at bat for a team until three outs are made.
shortDefinitions: single turn at bat for team until three outs

definitions: a division of play similar to an inning in other games, such as horseshoes.
shortDefinitions: similar division of play in other games

definitions: a period during which a person or group can achieve something

examples.text: she thought that now her inning had come

shortDefinitions: period during which person or group can achieve something
